content.description: Fairly easy climbing  on ledges gains the first bolt.   From here climb up trending slightly rightwards past two more bolts to the top.
content.location: The leftmost bolted route on the left slabby face.

content.description: Crosses the obvious left-leaning overlap/bulge at a weakness.
content.location: Roughly six feet left of the twin cracks of Rough Rider, on the Right section of the Horseshoe Slabs.

content.description: Delicate footwork trending right-ward aiming for top end of obvious left-leaning overlap-bulge feature. Then less-steep straight up to a large tree at top.
content.protection: Tree anchor at top. Top-Rope only.
content.location: About 5 feet right of Cowpuncher on the Right section of the Horseshoe Slabs. Same top anchor as Cowpuncher. (Not listed in the 3rd edition Lewis+Moynier guidebook)

content.description:
This was a top rope, but a couple of bolts have been added to allow it to be a lead climb.

Make some thin slab moves to the first bolt, pass this and then  up to some ledges.

Follow the second bolt and ledges to the anchors.
content.location: Left most climb on the right section.

content.description: Climb up the easy angled slab, starting on the far right.   Trend left as you climb up, then straight up with a slight move right towards the anchors.
content.location: Rightmost route on the left section of the crag

content.description:
Make some tricky moves up the wall on quartz dikes, until you get established on the slab.

Head straight up into the alcove with the anchors.
content.location: Left of the easy angle slab.

content.description: Climb up the steep wall onto the slab.   Follow slabby dikes tending rightwards to a bay and the anchors
content.location: First climb on the right of the bolt routes

content.description: Climb up the slab using parallel dikes.   After the start the difficulties ease.
content.protection:
TR.

Two-bolt anchor at top. Shared with next line to the right.

content.description: Climb up the face with thoughtful moves.
content.location: on the face half-way between the twin cracks of Rough Rider and the seam (with bolt 20 feet up) of Blacksmith - on the Right section of the Horseshoe Slabs.

content.description: Climb the fun slab with the crux about 2/3 of the way up.
content.location: Leftmost line on the left slab

content.description: Twin cracks lead to a single, blocky crack.  There are so many blocks and edges to choose from that no crack technique is required.
content.protection: A few pieces to 2".  The top now boasts a 2-bolt fixed anchor.
content.location:
Far right side of Horshoe Slabs.  Approach the top via a Class-2 ramp on the right.  For the specific location, click

here

content.description:
If the direct line to the first bolt is taken the start can prove quite tricky.   (There are some good slab boulder problems right of the start)

After the first bolt there is interesting slab climbing before another hard part after the 5th bolt.
content.location: Climbs the slab right of Wrangler.   It is the 2nd bolts line from the left.

content.description: Climb up the black streaked slabby face.
content.protection: Four bolts to a two-bolt top anchor is shared with the climb to its left.
content.location: Route lies just left of the leftmost bolted line.

content.description: Right-leaning crack starts about 7 feet off the ground, aims toward top end of obvious left-leaning overlap/bulge feature. Then less-steep straight up to the top.
content.protection: one guidebook says Trad gear up to 2 inches. Tree anchor at top.
content.location: Second route from left end of the Right section of Horseshoe slabs.

content.description:
Climb the outward flaring chimney to a large tree on the ledge above.

It is possible to jam and place gear in the back of the crack, for most of the route.  Different style of climbing from the other predominately crack & face climbs to the left and the slab climbs to the right.
content.protection:
Cams from .3" to 3" or set up top rope on tree.

The crack in the back of the chimney takes cams, but has not been cleaned.  It was somewhat dirty and wet from snowmelt, when climbed on June 4, 2018.
content.location: The chimney is right of the prominent gully and face climbs, at the far left end of the Horseshoe Slabs.  A large tree is visible on the ledge above the route.

content.description: Face climbing up a slab immediately left of a polished, white intrusion.  At about 30', you'll encounter the lone (and sketchy) bolt.
content.protection: 1 bolt, a few fiddly pieces in the tiny to 1-inch range.  Tree anchor.
content.location:
Far right side of Horshoe Slabs. Approach the top via a Class-2 ramp on the right. For the specific location, click

here
